intro: Hieracium rhombotum, commonly known as the rhomboid hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems and basal leaves that are often rhomboid in shape, giving it its specific epithet. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium rhombotum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
